column4: Exclusive: Akorn eyes $2 billion UCB unit in potential tax inversion - sources
column5: NEW YORK U.S. specialty drugmaker Akorn Inc  is exploring a bid for Belgian drugmaker UCB SA's  U.S. subsidiary  a deal that would allow the company to move its tax domicile overseas in a practice known as inversion  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: American Airlines scraps paper manuals for tablets to cut fuel costs
column5: American Airlines has won regulatory approval to swap flight attendants' paper manuals for lighter Samsung tablets in a change that will save nearly $1 million a year  the company said on Wednesday.

column4: American Airlines scraps paper manuals for tablets to cut fuel costs
column5: Sept 10 American Airlines has won regulatory approval to swap flight attendants' paper manuals for lighter Samsung tablets in a change that will save nearly $1 million a year  the company said on Wednesday.

column4: Health developers  doctors want to see more from Apple's watch
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Technology pundits were quick to predict the demise of most fitness wristbands and smartwatches when Apple Inc launched its Apple Watch. But healthcare professionals and fitness junkies were left wanting to see more.

Apple may be better positioned to succeed where other institutions have had  limited success given the company's financial resources and history of strong  new product adoption  according to Fitch Ratings.   We believe that the impact of any success on the payments industry remains  un

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St edges down; energy shares extend decline

column4: RPT-In search of the missing 'i' in Apple's Watch
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK  Sept 11 Apple Inc's  Tuesday launch was a marketing extravaganza stuffed full of gadgets  corporate hyperbole and celebrities of every stripe. One thing was missing: the "i" in front of the Watch.

column4: China misses out on first wave of new iPhone releases
column5: BEIJING Consumers in China  who represent an increasingly critical pillar of Apple Inc's business  will not be able to buy the new iPhone 6 as part of the first wave of buyers around the world this month.

column4: Apple payments service may boost sales of larger iPhones
column5: The addition of a mobile payments service to Apple Inc's next iPhone could help to boost sales of the larger-screen phones and claw back market share lost to mobiles running on Google Inc's Android platform. |Â Video

column4: UPDATE 1-China misses out on first wave of new iPhone releases
column5: BEIJING  Sept 11 Millions of people in China  increasingly a critical pillar of Apple Inc's business  may have to wait until the year-end before they can buy the new iPhone 6.

column4: Swiss stocks - Factors to watch on Sept 11
column5: ZURICH  Sept 11 Swiss stocks were expected to open higher on Thursday  in line with European markets seen tracking gains on Wall Street where Apple rebounded  boosted by bullish analyst notes.

column4: Home Retail says "no decision" to divest Homebase
column5: LONDON  Sept 11 The chief executive of Argos-owner Home Retail Group said the group had not taken a decision to sell its Homebase D.I.Y chain amid media speculation that the group could sell the division to private equity investors.

column4: UPDATE 1-Home Retail Group says Argos quarterly sales rise
column5: LONDON  Sept 11 Sales at Home Retail Group's  Argos household goods chain rose for the ninth quarter in row and gross margins recovered  although the sales increase fell short of market expectations.

column4: Home Retail Group says Argos like-for-like quarterly sales rise
column5: LONDON  Sept 11 Britain's Home Retail Group  posted its ninth consecutive quarter of improvement in like-for-like sales at its Argos household goods chain  although the rise was short of market expectations  accompanied by an increase in its gross margin at the stores.

column4: CBOE may hand off regulatory duties to independent agency
column5: CHICAGO CBOE Holdings Inc  operator of the largest U.S. stock-options market  may hand off some of its regulatory duties to the securities industry's largest independent regulator within the next several months  the company said on Thursday.

column5: WASHINGTON State attorneys general working to determine whether Comcast Corp's  deal to buy Time Warner Cable Inc  is legal have expanded their investigation to include AT&T Inc's  plans to buy DirecTV   according to sources close to the merger probe.

column4: UPDATE 2-Nevada lawmakers to consider huge tax breaks for Tesla
column5: CARSON CITY  Nev.  Sept 10 Nevada lawmakers convened in a special session on Wednesday to consider tax breaks and other incentives worth an estimated $1.3 billion to clinch a deal hammered out by Governor Brian Sandoval with Tesla Motors Inc to build a massive battery factory in the state.

column4: Long-awaited diet pill gets U.S. approval

column4: Boeing  Airbus seriously studying speeding factories
column5: WASHINGTON Boeing Co  and European rival Airbus  said on Thursday they are both considering seriously whether to make their best-selling narrow-body jetliners at faster rates  news that may cheer investors in the short term but could raise longer-term market concerns.

column4: Alcoa signs Boeing deal worth more than $1 billion
column5: Alcoa Inc  has signed a long-term contract to supply planemaker Boeing Co  with aluminum sheet and plate that is worth more than $1 billion  the metals company said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Alcoa signs Boeing deal worth more than $1 billion
column5: Sept 11 Alcoa Inc has signed a long-term contract to supply planemaker Boeing Co with aluminum sheet and plate that is worth more than $1 billion  the metals company said on Thursday.

column4: REUTERS SUMMIT-Boeing says has looked seriously at 737 output above 47 a month
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 11 Boeing Co has seriously considered increasing production of its 737 narrow-body airplanes to more than 47 a month  President and Chief Operating Officer Dennis Muilenburg said on Thursday.

column4: Boeing sees no production cut in move from 777 to 777X
column5: WASHINGTON Boeing Co  President and Chief Operating Officer Dennis Muilenburg said on Thursday the aircraft maker will not need to cut production as it makes the transition from its 777 jetliner to its new 777X model coming out in 2020.

column4: REUTERS SUMMIT-Boeing sees no production cut in move from 777 to 777X
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 11    Boeing Co  President and Chief Operating Officer Dennis Muilenburg said on Thursday the aircraft maker will not need to cut production as it makes the transition from its 777 jetliner to its new 777X model coming out in 2020.

column4: Airbus executive says U.S. Ex-Im Bank is aggressive on lending
column5: NEW YORK The president of Airbus Americas Inc  said on Thursday that the U.S. Export-Import Bank is more aggressive in offering good credit terms to help finance foreign sales of Boeing Co  aircraft than European export credit agencies.

column4: Alcoa signs Boeing deal worth more than $1 bln

column4: U.S.  EU ready new sanctions to stop oil exploration in Russia
column5: WASHINGTON The United States and European Union plan to stop billions of dollars in oil exploration in Russia by the world's largest energy companies including Exxon Mobil Corp and BP Plc  U.S. government sources said.

column4: CBS  Time Warner CEOs warm to stand-alone Showtime  HBO
column5: NEW YORK/LOS ANGELES Time Warner Inc and CBS Corp signaled on Wednesday that they were increasingly open to one day making HBO and Showtime available directly to consumers over the Internet without a subscription to a cable television service.

column4: THAILAND PRESS-China Mobile plans to increase Thai investment - The Nation
column5: China Mobile Ltd  the foreign strategic partner now owning 18 percent of True Corp Pcl  is interested in expanding its investment in Thailand  said Takorn Tantasith  secretary-general of the National Broadcasting and Telecommunications Commission. (http://bit.ly/1uJdjmn)

column4: Thailand's True Corp sees net profit in Q4
column5: BANGKOK  Sept 11 Thai telecoms operator True Corporation Pcl  controlled by billionaire Dhanin Chearavanont  expects to make a net profit in the fourth quarter of this year after years of losses  Chief executive Supachai Chearavanont said on Thursday.

column4: China misses out on first wave of new iPhone releases
column5: BEIJING  Sept 11 Consumers in China  who represent an increasingly critical pillar of Apple Inc's  business  will not be able to buy the new iPhone 6 as part of the first wave of buyers around the world this month.

column4: China gives cautious response to Obama's Islamic State call
column5: BEIJING  Sept 11 China responded cautiously on Thursday to a call by U.S. President Barack Obama for a broad coalition to root out Islamic State militants in Iraq and Syria  saying the world should fight terror but that the sovereignty of countries must be respected.

column4: UPDATE 2-Continental Resources president quits  leaves leadership gap
column5: Sept 11 Continental Resources Inc  the largest oil producer in North Dakota's Bakken shale formation  said on Thursday that Rick Bott  its president and chief operating officer  had resigned.

column4: Continental Resources president resigns for 'other opportunities'
column5: Sept 11 Continental Resources Inc  the largest oil producer in North Dakota's Bakken shale formation  said on Thursday that W.F. "Rick" Bott  its president and chief operating officer  has resigned to pursue other opportunities.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 11 Taminco Corp shares were up 11 percent on Thursday after Eastman Chemical Co  said it will acquire the specialty chemical company.

column5: WASHINGTON The United States and European Union plan to stop billions of dollars in oil exploration in Russia by the world's largest energy companies including Exxon Mobil Corp and BP Plc  U.S. government sources said.

column4: GM revamping India operation  product portfolio to revive sales
column5: NEW DELHI General Motors Co  is restructuring its India operation and evaluating its product portfolio  the U.S.-carmaker said on Thursday  as it looks to revive falling sales and increase market share in Asia's third-largest economy.

column4: UPDATE 1-GM revamping India operation  product portfolio to revive sales
column5: NEW DELHI  Sept 11 General Motors Co is restructuring its India operation and evaluating its product portfolio  the U.S.-carmaker said on Thursday  as it looks to revive falling sales and increase market share in Asia's third-largest economy.

column4: Opel to launch budget family car in Europe by 2015
column5: FRANKFURT General Motors  will launch a budget family car under the Vauxhall and Opel brands next year in a bid to woo customers of the company's Chevrolet brand  which is set to be discontinued in Europe at the end of 2015.

column4: GM to launch 40 new cars in India  other international markets
column5: NEW DELHI  Sept 11 General Motors Co  plans to launch 40 new cars in India and in other international markets excluding China  north America and Europe  Chief Executive Mary Barra said on Thursday.

column4: Televisa shares fall on plan to sell Iusca stake at a loss
column5: MEXICO CITY Shares in Mexico's leading broadcaster  Grupo Televisa  fell on Thursday  a day after it said it would sell its stake in Iusacell  the country's No. 3 wireless operator  at a loss.

column4: Allergan investors owning 35 percent to demand special meeting: sources
column5: NEW YORK Billionaire William Ackman has signed up Allergan  investors who combined own at least 35 percent of the company to call a special shareholder meeting  according to people familiar with the matter  giving the hedge fund manager a victory in his fight to acquire the Botox maker.

column4: Icahn wins three board seats at Hertz  shares jump

column4: Hertz to appoint three Icahn nominees to its board
column5: Sept 11 Car rental company Hertz Global Holdings Inc said it would add three directors nominated by billionaire investor Carl Icahn to its board.

column4: Two years after protests  "China risk" still haunts Japan firms
column5: DANYANG  China  Sept 12 Amid a revival in sales of Japanese goods in China and talk of renewed investment from some big firms such as Toyota  a dusty industrial park near Nanjing offers a cold reality check on the health of ties between Asia's two biggest economies.

column4: Indonesia's August motorbike sales rose 24.6 pct y/y
column5: JAKARTA  Sept 11 Indonesia's motorbike sales rebounded in August after a sharp fall on an annual basis the previous month  industry data showed on Thursday.     Sales in August were up 24.6 percent from a year earlier. In July  they fell 23.9 percent from one year earlier.     There were 609 198 motorbikes sold in Southeast Asia's biggest economy in August  or 14 percent more than the previous month  according to the Indonesian Motorbike Industry Association (AISI).      For August

column5: MADRID  Sept 11 Spain's Telefonica has set the coupon for a 1.5-billion euro ($1.94 billion) convertible bond  to be used partly to fund the acquisition of Germany's E-Plus  at 4.9 percent  the company said on Thursday.

column4: Blackstone to sell Burger King locations to franchisee -Bloomberg
column5: Sept 11 Blackstone Group LP plans to sell about 260 Burger King Worldwide Inc locations owned by a unit in the U.S. Midwest to Texas-based fast-food franchisee Houston Foods Inc  Bloomberg reported.

column4: UPDATE 1-Travelport's IPO values Blackstone-backed firm at $1.9 bln
column5: Sept 11 Airline ticketing company Travelport Worldwide Ltd's initial public offering is expected to be priced at $14-$16 per share  valuing the Blackstone Group LP  -backed company at $1.9 billion at the top end of the range.

column4: Blackstone-backed Travelport's IPO expected to raise $480 mln
column5: Sept 11 Airline ticketing company Travelport Worldwide Ltd's initial public offering is expected to raise up to $480 million  the Blackstone Group LP -backed company said in a regulatory filing.

column4: Two years after protests  'China risk' still haunts Japan firms
column5: DANYANG China Amid a revival in sales of Japanese goods in China and talk of renewed investment from some big firms such as Toyota  a dusty industrial park near Nanjing offers a cold reality check on the health of ties between Asia's two biggest economies.

column4: Toyota recalling 130 000 Tundras for air-bag issue
column5: DETROIT Toyota Motor Corp  is recalling 130 000 2014 Tundra pickup trucks to correct a problem with side air bags  the automaker's U.S. sales arm said Thursday.

column4: Allergan investors owning 35 percent to demand special meeting: sources
column5: NEW YORK Billionaire William Ackman has signed up Allergan  investors who combined own at least 35 percent of the company to call a special shareholder meeting  according to people familiar with the matter  giving the hedge fund manager a victory in his fight to acquire the Botox maker.

column4: Philips  IBA strike partnership deal for cancer centres
column5: BRUSSELS  Sept 11 Philips and Belgium's Ion Beam Applications announced a partnership on Thursday designed to combine IBA's cancer-therapy technology with Philips' medical imaging systems.

column4: Verizon CEO says to launch Web TV product in 2015
column5: NEW YORK Verizon Communications Inc  plans to launch an Internet-based television service in the first half of next year  its chief executive said on Thursday  in a move intended to shake up traditional cable and satellite TV services.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 11 Sprint Corp is seeking partners to expand its scale in the wireless market after the collapse of its long sought-after takeover of T-Mobile US Inc   Chief Executive Officer Marcelo Claure said on Thursday.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 11 Verizon Communications Inc  Chief Executive Lowell McAdam said on Thursday that the telecoms company would open to selling some of its towers if the price was right.

column4: UPDATE 1-Indian card payment network RuPay sees boost from government banking scheme
column5: MUMBAI  Sept 11 A government drive to expand banking services in India is giving a boost to home-grown card payment network RuPay  which expects to quadruple the number of users by March and make debit cards more acceptable in a nation where cash is still king.

column4: EMC plans to keep stake in VMware  despite investor pressure: source
column5: Boston EMC Corp plans to keep its majority stake in software maker VMware Inc despite pressure from activist hedge fund Elliott Management  a person familiar with EMC's thinking told Reuters on Thursday.
